Raydium DC xSPI Driver
devices

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides a hardware abstraction layer for Raydium display controllers with DC xSPI interface, optimized for RM67162, RM69330, and RM69090 driver ICs. It enables high-speed data transfer, display initialization, and region-based rendering for embedded applications requiring visual interfaces. The driver supports SPI4/DSPI/QSPI protocols, tearing effect control, and features for optimal display performance and system integration.

Key Features

  1. Multi-protocol Support: SPI4, DSPI, QSPI interfaces.
  2. Region-based Rendering: Efficient partial updates.
  3. Tearing Effect Control: Synchronization for smooth display.
  4. Power Management: Optimized for embedded systems.
  5. Display Initialization: Flexible configuration for various panels.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure Raydium xSPI display
  • Set up region and scanline parameters
  • Manage display timing and flip operations
  • Support for hardware reset and brightness control

Usage

  1. Initialize display with am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_init()
  2. Set region and scanline as needed
  3. Use hardware reset and flip functions for display control

Configuration

  • Configure SPI protocol and pixel format
  • Set up region and scanline parameters
  • Adjust brightness and tearing settings

Function Documentation

◆ am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_flip()

void am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_flip ( uint8_t ui8FlipXY)

Set the flip along with the x/y-axis or both the x and y-axis.

Parameters
ui8FlipXY- how to flip the display
Note
Register bits function for Driver IC RM69330 or CO5300. Bitfield 0 - Reserved (please don't set this bit) Bitfield 1 - Flip along with y-axis (reserved for CO5300) Bitfield 2 - Reserved Bitfield 3 - RGB or BGR order Bitfield 4 - Flip along with x-axis (reserved for CO5300) Bitfield 5 - Flip along y = x (reserved for CO5300) Bitfield 6 - Flip along with y-axis Bitfield 7 - Flip along with x-axis The x-axis will keep no flip when setting bitfields 4 and 7 same time. In the same way, the same is true for the y-axis. Please be careful some of the flips could cause the tear effect.
Returns
None.

◆ am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_hardware_reset()

void am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_hardware_reset ( void )

External function definitions.

Reset the display panel

This function resets the display panel by toggling reset pin.

◆ am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_init()

uint32_t am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_init ( am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_config_t * psDisplayPanelConfig)

Initialize raydium's IC RM67162, RM69090 or RM69330 with DC SPI4/DSPI/QSPI interface.

Parameters
psDisplayPanelConfig- Display panel configuration structure.
Note
This function configures display panel with the configurations in sDisplayPanelConfig. It should be called after NemaDC is initialized and configured.
Returns
status.

◆ am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_set_region()

uint32_t am_devices_dc_xspi_raydium_set_region ( uint16_t ui16ResX,
uint16_t ui16ResY,
uint16_t ui16MinX,
uint16_t ui16MinY )

Set the region to be updated.

Parameters
ui16ResX- X resolution of display region
ui16ResY- Y resolution of display region
ui16MinX- X-axis starting point of display region
ui16MinY- Y-axis starting point of display region

This function can be used to set display region of display driver IC.

Returns
status.

◆ am_devices_dc_xspi_set_scanline()

uint32_t am_devices_dc_xspi_set_scanline ( uint16_t ui16ScanLine,
uint16_t ui16ResY )

Set scanline.

Parameters
ui16ScanLine- scanline index
ui16ResY- Y resolution of display panel
Note
This function is used to set scanline index. It will return error when given scanline is greater than or equal to display maximum resolution.
Returns
status.

◆ am_devices_dc_xspi_set_scanline_with_recommended_parameter()

uint32_t am_devices_dc_xspi_set_scanline_with_recommended_parameter ( uint8_t TETimesPerFrame,
uint16_t ui16ResY )

Set scanline with recommended parameter.

Parameters
TETimesPerFrame- How many TE interrupts during transfering one frame
ui16ResY- Y resolution of display panel
Note
This function is used to set scanline with recommended parameter, it's valid when ui8TEIntTimesPerFrame equals to 1 or 2.
Returns
status.
